arm_group.description: Each subject will be imaged in a dynamic MRI with both a oronasal and nasal  mask  at  pressures  of	5,  10,  and 15  cm  of  H2O.

brief_summary.textblock:
Our group has recently found that the choice of positive airway pressure mask can
      significantly affect the pressure required to adequately treat sleep disordered breathing.
      The goal of this study is to visualize the upper airway in the retropalatal and retroglossal
      region while using both oronasal and nasal masks with CPAP in order to investigate
      differences in upper airway dynamics that may occur between these two mask types.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study of the Comparison of the Upper Airway Dynamics of Oronasal vs Nasal Masks With Positive Airway Pressure Treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  AHI> 30/hr

          -  18-75 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  History of claustrophobia

          -  History of pacemaker, nerve stimulator, or any other metal implanted device

intervention.description: Subjects will be imaged via MRI wearing a nasal and oronasal PAP mask at 5, 10 and 15 cm H20.

facility.name: Weill Cornell Center for Sleep Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of the Comparison of the Upper Airway Dynamics of Oronasal vs Nasal Masks With Positive Airway Pressure Treatment

oversight_info.authority: Weill Cornell Institutional Review Board, USA:

primary_outcome.description: MRI will be used to take airway measurements and the position of soft tissue elements of the oropharyngeal airway will be evaluated while positive airway pressure in introduced through either an oronasal or nasal mask.
primary_outcome.measure: MRI of airway with oronasal or nasal mask

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: MRI will be used to obtain airway measurements and the position of soft tissue elements of the oropharyngeal airway will be evaluated while positive airway pressure in introduced through the opposite mask type.
secondary_outcome.measure: MRI of upper airway with opposite PAP mask

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
